blog.name: your-fave-is-a-cinnamonroll
blog.title: THEY'RE ALL PRECIOUS CINNAMON ROLLS
blog.description:
ASKS/SUBMISSIONS ARE CURRENTLY OPEN! Submit your favorite cinnamon roll characters! 💜 
I only post 2 characters at a time. If you request multiple characters at a once, they'll be posted once a day! 
Tumblr user requests will be posted every Tuesday (Tumblr User Tuesdays)! 
All images are found on Google, if I happen to use art that belongs to you please let me know and I will credit you~

Please do not interact with NSFW posts or ask NSFW questions unless you are 18+.

summary: I’ve got Ducktales on tv while I wait  for BH6: The Series to start and the character that David Tennant plays is using the same...
body: I’ve got Ducktales on tv while I wait  for BH6: The Series to start and the character that David Tennant plays is using the same voice as he does for Spitelout (his natural accent, right?) and it’s like, Spitelout is a duck now.

blog.name: someonesmind
blog.title: Someones Mind
blog.description:
... the only people that interest me are the mad ones, the ones who are mad to live, mad to talk, desirous of everything at the same time, the ones that never yawn or say a commonplace thing... but burn, burn, burn like roman candles across the night.
- Jack Kerouac, On the Road

summary: Right, okay, so I just finished watching Broadchurch (season 1). I can’t have been the only one to have figured out who it was,...
body: Right, okay, so I just finished watching Broadchurch (season 1). I can’t have been the only one to have figured out who it was, right? I came up with the idea of who was the murderer by the end of episode 5, but I got the motive wrong.

reblog.comment: Right, okay, so I just finished watching Broadchurch (season 1). I can’t have been the only one to have figured out who it was, right? I came up with the idea of who was the murderer by the end of episode 5, but I got the motive wrong.

trail.content_raw: Right, okay, so I just finished watching Broadchurch (season 1). I can’t have been the only one to have figured out who it was, right? I came up with the idea of who was the murderer by the end of episode 5, but I got the motive wrong.
trail.content: Right, okay, so I just finished watching Broadchurch (season 1). I can’t have been the only one to have figured out who it was, right? I came up with the idea of who was the murderer by the end of episode 5, but I got the motive wrong.

blog.name: cleowho
blog.title: Flight Through Eternity
blog.description:
Classic Doctor Who / Contemporary Doctor Who blog by Chloe "Cleo" Mortimer.
British fan girl and obsessive Whonatic. Tweets @CleoWho
All posts created exclusively by me unless they're marked as reblogs. Expect SPOILERS, because you can't enthuse over fifty years of a TV show and keep everything that's happened a secret.
Comments and opinions are entirely my own. Original text entries are copyright (c) Chloe Mortimer.

title: "tennant is ecstatic about the beards"
body:
this is from that interview with the church photoshoot. sheen has his usual beard and tennant also has a freshly grown beard for unknown reasons.

…like

is he just super pumped to be twinsies with his new bff michael sheen?? Because that’s what I’m getting here????

DT fans who know him better than i, what say you?????? Don’t make me @ u direct!y BECAUSE I WILL

blog.name: fuckyeahgoodomens
blog.title: Fuck Yeah Good Omens
blog.description: Funniest apocalypse ever!

summary: ScifiNow Magazine (source) But at its heart are Aziraphale and Crowley, the respective representatives of good and evil on...
caption:
ScifiNow Magazine (source)

But at its heart are Aziraphale and Crowley, the respective representatives of good and evil on Earth. By rights they should hate each other, but having been here since the Garden of Eden, having enjoyed all of humanity’s quirks together, they’ve become accustomed to each other’s company and their adopted home. Hence their panic when word comes up from below that Crowley has been charged with placing the Antichrist - he who will kickstart Armageddon - with the optimum human family. 

“There’s a great sequence at the beginning of episode three,” explains Tennant. "where we jump-cut a few hundred years and we see them at Christ’s crucifixion, at Noah’s Ark, we see them in Shakespeare’s Globe, we see them in the Second World War, and we get glimpses of their life through the millennia, and you see this developing relationship where they’ve started on opposing teams, and yet as the story goes on they inevitably drift towards each other, and indeed inherit this common goal to avert the apocalypse. Really for no other reason than that they’re quite enjoying their life. They don’t want to have to go back to pushing paper. They like dining at the Ritz and this thing known as wine that human beings have invented and fast cars and all that sort of stuff. It’s entirely selfish, but it does mean that their common goal makes them unlikely allies." 

"I remember hearing either Paul or John or someone within The Beatles saying that because no one had ever gone through that before, no one could understand what they were going through,” adds Sheen. “And the only way for them to stay sane was because they were all going through it at the same time, And I sort of feel the same way about Crowley and Aziraphale. No one else knows what it’s like to be on Earth for the whole time since the Garden of Eden. There’s a bond that grows between them because of that, and so consequently they start to become more like each other in a way." 

"He’s an angel who is not without his flashes of naughtiness,” says Tennant, “and I’m a demon who has been known to do the right thing occasionally.”

But at its heart are Aziraphale and Crowley, the respective representatives of good and evil on Earth. "where we jump-cut a few hundred years and we see them at Christ’s crucifixion, at Noah’s Ark, we see them in Shakespeare’s Globe, we see them in the Second World War, and we get glimpses of their life through the millennia, and you see this developing relationship where they’ve started on opposing teams, and yet as the story goes on they inevitably drift towards each other, and indeed inherit this common goal to avert the apocalypse. Really for no other reason than that they’re quite enjoying their life. They don’t want to have to go back to pushing paper. It’s entirely selfish, but it does mean that their common goal makes them unlikely allies." 

"I remember hearing either Paul or John or someone within The Beatles saying that because no one had ever gone through that before, no one could understand what they were going through,” adds Sheen. “And the only way for them to stay sane was because they were all going through it at the same time, And I sort of feel the same way about Crowley and Aziraphale. "He’s an angel who is not without his flashes of naughtiness,” says Tennant, “and I’m a demon who has been known to do the right thing occasionally.”

blog.name: d4whpod
blog.title: D4WH: A Doctor Who Podcast.
blog.description:
Australia's Funniest Doctor Who
Podcast!

summary:
Hello Tumblr! 
My name is BekTech and I’m the audio technician/half-editor of the biggest and funniest Doctor Who podcast in...
body:
Hello Tumblr!

My name is BekTech and I’m the audio technician/half-editor of the biggest and funniest Doctor Who podcast in Australia, D4WH (otherwise known as Doctor Who, What, Where, When and How)!

With my hosts, comedian extraordinaires and dear friends, Adam O’Sullivan and Nicchia Schutt, we bring you quality Doctor Who review content in hilarious new podcast episodes every Wednesday (AEST)!

I hope all the lovely Whovians out here on Tumblr will welcome us into their ear canals and will enjoy the ride along the way- if in doubt, we have 27 episodes for you all to catch up with!

You can subscribe to D4WH on the following platforms:

iTunes: https://podcasts.apple.com/au/podcast/d4wh-a-doctor-who-podcast/id1441247257

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/5Vj7Zoi0ElCw4l1UYSgtBt?si=alseKgT6Q5OzMxaf6dLRjQ

Podbean: https://thenerdinfinite.podbean.com/

Happy Listening!

blog.name: tinsnip
blog.title: No, said Aziraphale, it's ineffable.
blog.description:
Hello, I'm tinsnip.

Feeling rather ineffable these days. Expect a great deal of Good Omens.

Other interests: Star Trek. (Primarily DS9 and Cardassians.)
Pratchett. Wodehouse.
Cats. The Doctors Whom. Science. Cute things. Life truths. Pixels. And spiders, sometimes, so keep that in mind.

I post fic on AO3. It's quite good - you should have a look.

My work with Vyc on a Kardasi conlang is here.

Cardassian meta is found mostly under cardassians or kardasi.

If you enjoy my fanfic, why not buy me a coffee?

tags: i mean it's cute but also sighhh
summary: God dammit, I can’t enjoy pretty photo shoots of Tennant and Sheen anymore. I just think of them both being grumpy bitches....
body:
God dammit, I can’t enjoy pretty photo shoots of Tennant and Sheen anymore. I just think of them both being grumpy bitches.

“Something a little warmer? Hint of a smile?”

“Fuck off. I hate you now.”

reblog.comment:

body:

  1. First destination you would like to visit via the TARDIS?
  2. Top 3 favourite quotes?
  3. Favourite Doctor/Doctors?
  4. Favourite Companion/ Companions?
  5. Top 3 seasons of New Who?

  1. First destination you would like to visit via the TARDIS?
  2. Top 3 favourite quotes?
  3. Favourite Doctor/Doctors?
  4. Favourite Companion/ Companions?
  5. Top 3 seasons of New Who?

Submit any to my inbox
